intro: Dicliptera lutea, commonly known as yellow dicliptera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and yellowish-green foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typically wind-pollinated. Dicliptera lutea is often found in open grasslands and disturbed soils, showing adaptability to various environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
